org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.reactors

Class ReactorBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.reactors.ReactorBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, Blade, Closeable, Reactor
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BlockingReactor, IsolationReactor, NonBlockingReactor, ThreadBoundReactor

    public abstract class ReactorBase
extends java.lang.Object
implements Reactor
    Base class for reactors.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: Reactor
        When a reactor is closed, the following occurs:
        1. This reactor is removed from the closeables list of the reactors it depends on.
        2. All requests sent by this reactor which are still outstanding are canceled.
        3. All the closables in this reactor's closeables list are closed.
        4. All the requests/responses that have been sent but which have not yet been disbursed to their destinations are distributed immediately.
        5. All incoming requests/responses that have not yet been processed are closed.
        6. If there is an active current request, it is interrupted. If it does not complete or throw an exception then hung thread recovery is initiated.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface Reactor
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • nullSReq

        public SyncRequest<java.lang.Void> nullSReq()
        Description copied from interface: Reactor
        Returns a request targeted to the reactor that does nothing. Used for synchronizing state with another reactor.
        Specified by:
        nullSReq in interface Reactor
        Returns:
        A request that does nothing.

      • getRecovery

        public Recovery getRecovery()
        Description copied from interface: Reactor
        Returns the Recovery object used by this reactor. The default value is the Recovery object used by the parent reactor when this reactor was created.
        Specified by:
        getRecovery in interface Reactor
        Returns:
        The Recovery object.
